page.paragraph: Now listen to two students as they discuss the message.
Did you read the president's announcement?
I did. I was wondering what was going to happen because, you know, we missed so many days of classes. What do you think of the decision they made?
It seems like a reasonable solution, I guess, but, well, it's going to be a problem for me.
What kind of problem are you going to have?
I've got a summer job, and I'm supposed to start the job on June 1, but now I've got to be in school until the fifth, so I won't be able to start the job on the first.
Can't you ask if you can start the job late?
I don't know. I'm working at a summer camp, as a camp counselor, and the camp opens on June 1. I don't know if I'll be able to start late.
That would be too bad if you couldn't take that job.
It sure would. Now, what about you? You won't have any problem because of this change?
I don't think so. I don't have a job this summer; I'm going to summer school instead, and I have a class that starts on June 8.
That means you'll just lose a week of vacation. That's too bad.
